required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Plasma Levels of MK0633 in Children Ages 6-12 (0633-023)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open-Label, Single Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Plasma Concentration Profiles of MK0633 in Asthmatic Children Aged 6 to Less Than 12 Years

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety, tolerability and plasma levels of single oral doses of MK0633 in pediatric asthma patients ages 6 to less than 12 years.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of single oral doses of MK0633 in pediatric asthma patients.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Physical examinations, vital sign measurements, laboratory safety tests (blood chemistry, hematology and urinalysis), urine ß-hCG test, and 12-lead ECGs will be performed at various scheduled time points throughout the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: To obtain information on plasma pharmacokinetics (e.g., AUC0-inf, Cmax, Tmax, apparent t½,) of MK0633 after a single oral dose administration in pediatric asthma patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Plasma will be analyzed at specific time-points for MK0633 concentrations. Urine will be collected for the measurement of LTE4 concentration.

intervention.description: A single dose of MK0633 10 mg or 25 mg film coated tablet. Dose will be based on patient weight.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient has mild to moderate asthma
- Patient is able to swallow pills
- Patient is able to have have blood draws
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient has required a visit to the hospital or emergency room due to an asthmatic event in the last 3 months
- Patient has an upper respiratory tract infection (URI)
- Patient has a history of stroke
- Patient consumes more than 4 caffeinated beverages per day
